message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the effects of heat on frozen objects. When a frozen steak is exposed to the sun all day, it will defrost and become thawed. Option (B) is incorrect because freezing requires low temperatures, which the sun does not provide. Option (C) is not a possibility for inanimate objects like steak. Option (D) is not related to the physical changes that occur when a frozen steak is exposed to the sun.

This question requires some basic knowledge about temperature and the freezing point of water. When a frozen steak is exposed to the sun all day, the heat from the sun will cause the steak to defrost. This is because the sun's energy raises the temperature of the steak above the freezing point of water, causing the ice crystals in the steak to melt and turn back into liquid water. Option (B) is incorrect because freezing occurs at temperatures below the freezing point of water, which the sun's heat would prevent. Option (C) and (D) are not scientifically possible and not related to the physical properties of frozen steak.
